intro: Microlicia virgata var. subpatens, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microlicia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are typically less than 10 cm in length. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. This variant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
